t: Proverbs 16
To*pn humans belong the plans of the heart, but*ld from the Lord*s comes the proper answer of the tongue.
All*pn a person’s ways seem pure to them, but*ld motives are weighed by the Lord.*s
Commit*pn to the Lord*s whatever you do, and*ld he will establish your plans.
The*pn Lord*s works out everything to its proper end— even*ld the wicked for a day of disaster.
The*pn Lord*s detests all the proud of heart. Be*ld sure of this: They will not go unpunished.
Through*pn love and faithfulness sin is atoned for; through*ld the fear of the Lord*s evil is avoided.
When*pn the Lord*s takes pleasure in anyone’s way, he*ld causes their enemies to make peace with them.
Better*pn a little with righteousness than*ld much gain with injustice.
In*pn their hearts humans plan their course, but*ld the Lord*s establishes their steps.
The*pn lips of a king speak as an oracle, and*ld his mouth does not betray justice.
Honest*pn scales and balances belong to the Lord;*s all*ld the weights in the bag are of his making.
Kings*pn detest wrongdoing, for*ld a throne is established through righteousness.
Kings*pn take pleasure in honest lips; they*ld value the one who speaks what is right.
A*pn king’s wrath is a messenger of death, but*ld the wise will appease it.
When*pn a king’s face brightens, it means life; his*ld favor is like a rain cloud in spring.
How*pn much better to get wisdom than gold, to*ld get insight rather than silver!
The*pn highway of the upright avoids evil; those*ld who guard their ways preserve their lives.
Pride*pn goes before destruction, a*ld haughty spirit before a fall.
Better*pn to be lowly in spirit along with the oppressed than*ld to share plunder with the proud.
Whoever*pn gives heed to instruction prospers, and*ld blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord.*s
The*pn wise in heart are called discerning, and*ld gracious words promote instruction.
Prudence*pn is a fountain of life to the prudent, but*ld folly brings punishment to fools.
The*pn hearts of the wise make their mouths prudent, and*ld their lips promote instruction.
Gracious*pn words are a honeycomb, sweet*ld to the soul and healing to the bones.
There*pn is a way that appears to be right, but*ld in the end it leads to death.
The*pn appetite of laborers works for them; their*ld hunger drives them on.
A*pn scoundrel plots evil, and*ld on their lips it is like a scorching fire.
A*pn perverse person stirs up conflict, and*ld a gossip separates close friends.
A*pn violent person entices their neighbor and*ld leads them down a path that is not good.
Whoever*pn winks with their eye is plotting perversity; whoever*ld purses their lips is bent on evil.
Gray*pn hair is a crown of splendor; it*ld is attained in the way of righteousness.
Better*pn a patient person than a warrior, one*ld with self-control than one who takes a city.
The*pn lot is cast into the lap, but*ld its every decision is from the Lord.*s
